================================================================== body { padding: 30px; } ================================================================== Show Modal Form

A Modal Form

Your favorite weather?

@model MVC_EF_Parent_Child.ViewModel.ParentChildViewModel @{ ViewBag.Title = "Edit Children for Parent"; } @using (Html.BeginForm()){ @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.EventCommand) @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.EventArgument) @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.PageMode) @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.ChildRecord.T3ChildDetailPk) if (!Model.IsValid) {
@Html.ValidationSummary(false)
} if (Model.IsSearchAreaVisible) {

Search for Products

@Html.LabelFor(m => m.ChildSearchEntity.T0ParentFk, "Select a Parent") @Html.DropDownListFor(m => m.ChildSearchEntity.T0ParentFk, new SelectList(Model.ListOfParentSearchEntities, "T0ParentPk", "ParentData"), new { @class = "form-control" })
@Html.LabelFor(m => m.ChildSearchEntity.ChildData, "Child Data") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.ChildSearchEntity.ChildData, new { @class = "form-control" })
} if (Model.IsDetailAreaVisible) {

Product Information

@Html.LabelFor(m => m.ChildRecord.T0Parent.T0ParentPk, "Parent Data") @Html.DropDownListFor(m => m.ChildRecord.T0Parent.T0ParentPk, new SelectList(Model.ListOfParentRecords, "T0ParentPk", "ParentData"), new { @class = "form-control" })
@*@Html.LabelFor(m => m.ChildRecord.ChildData, "Child PK") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.ChildRecord.T3ChildDetailPk, new { @class = "form-control" })*@ @Html.LabelFor(m => m.ChildRecord.ChildData, "Child Data") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.ChildRecord.ChildData, new {@class = "form-control"})
} if (Model.IsListAreaVisible) {
@foreach (var item in Model.ListOfChildRecords) { }
Edit Child Pk Child Data Delete
@item.T3ChildDetailPk @item.ChildData
} } @section scripts { }

//02_TwitterBootstrap_Validation_ModalPartial__/Views/People/_Detals.cshtml @model BootstrapModalTest.Models.Person

Person Details

@Html.DisplayNameFor(model => model.FirstName)
@Html.DisplayFor(model => model.FirstName)
@Html.DisplayNameFor(model => model.LastName)
@Html.DisplayFor(model => model.LastName)
@Html.DisplayNameFor(model => model.Email)
@Html.DisplayFor(model => model.Email)

@model PTCViewModel @{ ViewBag.Title = "Paul's Training Company"; } @using (Html.BeginForm()) { @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.EventCommand) @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.EventArgument) @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.PageMode) @Html.HiddenFor(m => m.Entity.ProductId) if (!Model.IsValid) {
@Html.ValidationSummary(false)
} if (Model.IsSearchAreaVisible) {

Search for Products

@Html.LabelFor(m => m.SearchEntity.CategoryId, "Select a Product Category") @Html.DropDownListFor(m => m.SearchEntity.CategoryId, new SelectList(Model.SearchCategories, "CategoryId", "CategoryName"), new { @class = "form-control" })
@Html.LabelFor(m => m.SearchEntity.ProductName, "Product Name") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.SearchEntity.ProductName, new { @class = "form-control" })
} if (Model.IsDetailAreaVisible) {

Product Information

@Html.LabelFor(m => m.Entity.Category.CategoryId, "Product Category") @Html.DropDownListFor(m => m.Entity.Category.CategoryId, new SelectList(Model.Categories, "CategoryId", "CategoryName"), new { @class = "form-control" })
@Html.LabelFor(m => m.Entity.ProductName, "Product Name") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.Entity.ProductName, new { @class = "form-control" })
@Html.LabelFor(m => m.Entity.IntroductionDate, "Introduction Date") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.Entity.IntroductionDate, new { @class = "form-control" })
@Html.LabelFor(m => m.Entity.Url, "Url") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.Entity.Url, new { @class = "form-control" })
@Html.LabelFor(m => m.Entity.Price, "Price") @Html.TextBoxFor(m => m.Entity.Price, new { @class = "form-control" })
} if (Model.IsListAreaVisible) {
@foreach (var item in Model.Products) { }
Edit Product Name Introduction Date Url Price Delete
@item.ProductName @item.IntroductionDate @item.Url @item.Price.Value.ToString("c")
} } @section scripts { }

> Mount-DiskImage -ImagePath "E:\ISO-Files\My US Visit Fall 2010 Pictures.iso"
> Dismount-DiskImage -ImagePath "E:\ISO-Files\My US Visit Fall 2010 Pictures.iso"

This Worked. You need the installer media for Windows 10. That is where the path to the file it needs is located. http://serverfault.com/questions/750562/net-framework-3-5-error-code-0x800f081f From an Admin launch of command prompt ( or powershell as administrator) run:
>Dism /online /enable-feature /featurename:NetFx3 /All /Source:D:\sources\sxs
rebooted

Stop_Resetting_Default_Apps ----------------------------
https://4sysops.com/archives/default-file-associations-in-windows-10/
To deploy the default file associations, you first have to configure the settings on a reference machine and then export the configuration in an XML file that you can deploy in your network.
1] You can configure the settings in the Control Panel under Programs > Default Programs > Set Default Program.
2] Once you do that, you have to open a command prompt with the user account from above and use the DISM tool to export the current settings to an .XML file, as shown below.
>Dism.exe /online /Export-DefaultAppAssociations:C:\DATA\DefaultApplications\DefaultApps.xml
{See below for example of the file for Windows 10 Build 1709}
Now you have a .XML file with all the file associations from that user. People often ask me if it is possible to deploy just one file association or if they must use the entire file, which also contains all the default settings. The answer is, yes, you can import just the association you need.
3] Deploying default file associations using Group Policy
You can also deploy the default file associations using Group Policy: Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > File Explorer
Set the Group Policy https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/internet-explorer/ie11-deploy-guide/set-the-default-browser-using-group-policy =============================================================================================================
1] Open your Group Policy editor and go to the following policy
Administrative Templates\Windows Components\File Explorer\Set a default associations configuration file setting
a] Enabled
b] Default Associations Configuration File
C:\DATA\DefaultApplications\DefaultApps.xml
Export or Import Default Application Associations https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh825038.aspx =============================================================
EXPORT (e.g. Dism /Online /Export-DefaultAppAssociations:\\Server\Share\AppAssoc.xml)
IMPORT (mount image) Dism /Mount-Image /ImageFile:C:\test\images\install.wim /Name:"Windows" /MountDir:C:\test\offline (Import the .xml file that has the default application association settings to the Windows image. For example, at the command prompt type the following command:)
=================================================================
